Sarah McLarnan is a first year Environmental Health doctoral student at Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health, specializing in developmental neurotoxicology. Sarah grew up in Minnesota just outside the Twin Cities spending summers up north camping and canoeing and winters playing the backyard with her sisters. She studied environmental studies and biology at the College of Saint Benedict in Minnesota and had her first research experience through an undergraduate EPA fellowship. In 2017 Sarah moved to New York City to begin a masters program in Environmental Health Sciences at Columbia University. After graduating in 2019 she elected to stay and pursue a doctoral degree. Sarah now lives in Inwood with her best friend, a golden retriever named Wesley.
